10.heading: Orii, Sano.
10.title: White Tiger : a Hero's Compulsion
10.author: writers, Tamora Pierce, Timothy Liebe ; artist, Phil Briones.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.

"The Yakuza's bloodthirsty Sano Orii returns, a genocidal shadow organization appears, and a new-but-old super-powered madman is looking to put the squeeze on White Tiger. Armed with mystical amulets - and finally in costume - White Tiger demands answers! But will she survive long enough to ask the right questions?".

78.heading: Orion Books.
78.title: Asterix and Obelix's Birthday : the Golden Book
78.author: Rene Goscinny, Albert Uderzo.
notes: Translation of: L'Anniversaire d'Astérix et Obélix: le Livre d'Or.
Numbered: "34".

79.heading: Orion Books.
79.title: Asterix and the Class Act
79.author: written by René Goscinny and Albert Uderzo ; illustrated by Albert Uderzo ; translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: "Fourteen all-new Asterix stories."
Translation from the French of: Astérix et la Rentrée Gauloise.

80.heading: Orion Books.
80.title: Asterix and the Falling Sky
80.author: written and illustrated by Albert Uderzo ; translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: Translation of: Le Ciel lui Tombe sur la Tête.
At head of title: Goscinny and Uderzo present an Asterix adventure.

"The Gauls have only one fear: that the sky may fall on their heads tomorrow. But tomorrow never comes, says chief Vitalstatistix. Or does it? It looks as if it's come at last for Asterix, Obelix and the other villagers. And some surprising new characters fall along with the sky. Our friends soon find themselves in the middle of a space race..."

81.heading: Orion Books.
81.title: Asterix and the Picts
81.author: written by Jean-Yves Ferri ; illustrated by Didier Conrad ; translated by Anthea Bell ; color by Thierry Mébarki, Murielle Leroi, Raphaël Delerue.
notes: (An Asterix Adventure ; 35)

"When Asterix and Obelix rescue a mysterious Pict named MacAroon, they must journey to Caledonia, now Scotland, to return him to his lady love, Camomilla, the adopted daughter of the old king. However, the treacherous chieftain, MacCabaeus, plans to marry her and claim the throne, with the help of the Romans! What with caber-tossing, bagpipes, malted water and an enormous otter in the loch, can the Gauls reunite MacAroon and Camomilla and enjoy some Roman-bashing along the way?"
Translation of: Astérix chez les Pictes.

82.heading: Orion Books.
82.title: Asterix in Britain
82.author: written by René Goscinny and illustrated by Albert Uderzo ; translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: Revised ed.
(An Asterix Adventure ; 8)
Translated from the French.
Original title: Astérix chez les Bretons.

83.heading: Orion Books.
83.title: Goscinny and Uderzo present Asterix and the Vikings : the Book of the Film
83.author: translated by Anthea Bell.
notes: (An Asterix Adventure ; 34)
Translation of: Astérix et les Vikings.

"Meet Chief Timandahaf the Viking, his fierce warriors and his daughter Abba, as Asterix and Obelix do when the Vikings visit Gaul to learn the meaning of fear. For they believe fear will lend them wings, and they'd love to fly. Carried off to the frozen North, trendy young Justforkix from Lutetia claims to know all about it. But will he or someone else put the Vikings to flight?"

99.heading: Orissa.
99.title: "Jagannatha of Puri : Dreamt by a King, Sculpted by the Gods"
99.author: script, Gayatri Modan Dutt ; illustrations, Souren Roy ; editor, Anant Pai
99.appears_in: p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 709 (1983, 2009 printing).
notes: (Epics & Mythology)

Summary from back cover: "King Indradyumna of Utkal had only one wish, to be able to build a temple that would be the most beautiful in the world. His quest was for the image of the blue-coloured Krishna or Nilamadhav. The king came very close to achieving his goal but his pride and arrogance snatched it away from him leaving him groping once more in the dark. Contained in this Amar Chitra Katha is the legend behind the temple of Jagannathapuri in Orissa and the images enshrined in it."

100.heading: Oriti, Marjene.
100.title: "Millie Flies to Paris"
100.author: by Stan Lee ; Dan De Carlo
100.appears_in: 7 p. in Millie the Model Comics, no. 64 (Nov. 1955).
notes: Summary: Millie goes to France to represent her modeling agency in the annual fashion show. The pilots delay the takeoff to be sure she's comfortable. A brass band meets her plane, but it's for the world junior yo-yo champion, not Millie. A taxi driver takes her to a run-down hotel he happens to own. She asks directions of a woman from Brooklyn, and a policeman pinches her cheek. Millie wins first prize while modeling in her street clothes.
Fashions credited to Nikki Wilson and Marjene Oriti.
